channel.title: Silab help
channel.description:
when ever i try to go to client.silabsoft.org i get this error
Error_loader_client - Unable to download client. silabclient was unable to download the client file
# Login to your computer as an 'administator' user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file.
# Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS\.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files.
i looked in the path thay said and i do have that file. it is a read/wright file. but still it says it cant load the cache. any way to fix this prob? i even restarted my comp. dident work and for some reason the download version of silab seems to have a conn error. it will say "Requesting title" "Connection error retrying-10.9.8....."
one more thing. when i try to upload my server (when silab was working for me) on the mopar server list. it kept saying that its off line. witch i know its not. because my no-ip prog is running just fine.
yes i am portfowarding. and no i don't have any firewalls blocking any conn with silab soft/no-ip
And sorry if this is in the wrong place to put this type of thred, but i dident know were els to put it

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @nubra nubra
item.description:
@nubra wrote:

no you see. I just want to use the webclient to play. Or i want to use the downloaded version. But they don’t both work. And i think its because i don’t have that cache file, because it says “unable to find “that certain file”” when i try to run the client. So can you plz show me how to make it?

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

how do i make my own client? do i need to know how to C++ or java? cuz i know some java but c++ im not to good at.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

You don’t usually have to create a new directory, Or Set administrator privilages,
Your should just be able to run the client and it’ll automatically Download the Cache.

If you have problems with The ‘Silabsoft’ client, Then just make your own one and Add the items
That you want added yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @nubra nubra
item.description:
@nubra wrote:

I know this sounds like a retarded question. I am very new to this silab client thing. How exactly do i create a “directory”? Is that like a folder or something? Plz help.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

advertising
[center] Read the rules: advertising is not allowed.[/center]

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Do what the error tells you to do then;

# Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS\.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

nop just me.and i have avg pro so i dont believe there is a virus. and yes avg is allowing silab soft and all its components. u know what it might be. i ran disc cleanup yesterday. maybe it saw it was a rare file and erased some of its components? because the file is there. and it has everything…idk. and nothing is compressed. there for it should work right. and its all read/wright type files.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

There is only One computer side?

If so i’m not saying that you Have it or anything, But you may have a virus,
This has happened to my friend before, i doubt you have one though.

Is there any other users on your computer, I don’t mean if theres anybody on your side,
On any different side of the computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

oh i know what u mean. but there is only one user. and im on it atm. so that should automatically make me admin right?

Yup im the admin iv always been the admin

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

It’s nothing to do with going to C:,

You go to your parents side or whatever, Then navigate to the ‘Computer Users’ of your computer,
Then change your permissions.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

ummmm im not to sure. how would i check that? iv done it before but i dont really mess around in the admin stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

# Login to your computer as an 'administator' user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file.

Does your side of the Computer have ‘Administrator’ privilages, You need them
For most programs.

Read full topic

item.title: Silab help
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

when ever i try to go to client.silabsoft.org i get this error

Error_loader_client - Unable to download client.
silabclient was unable to download the client file

Login to your computer as an ‘administator’ user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file.

Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files.

i looked in the path thay said and i do have that file. it is a read/wright file. but still it says it cant load the cache. any way to fix this prob? i even restarted my comp. dident work and for some reason the download version of silab seems to have a conn error. it will say “Requesting title” “Connection error retrying-10.9.8…”

one more thing. when i try to upload my server (when silab was working for me) on the mopar server list. it kept saying that its off line. witch i know its not. because my no-ip prog is running just fine.

yes i am portfowarding. and no i don’t have any firewalls blocking any conn with silab soft/no-ip

And sorry if this is in the wrong place to put this type of thred, but i dident know were els to put it

Read full topic
